comment:
Based on the feedback provided by your colleagues, it is evident that the code you have reviewed is well-structured and effectively solves the optimization problem of maximizing the fish catch while considering constraints. Here are some key points to consider:

1. Variable Naming: Consider using more descriptive variable names such as 'net_acres' and 'line_acres' instead of 'i' and 'j' to enhance readability and maintainability of the code.

2. Comments: While the existing comments are helpful, consider adding more detailed comments to explain the logic behind certain calculations or decisions in the code. This will make it easier for other developers to understand the code in the future.

3. Code Efficiency: The current implementation uses nested loops to iterate through all possible combinations of net and fishing line acres. While this approach works for small inputs, it may not be efficient for larger inputs. Consider optimizing the code for better performance by exploring alternative algorithms or data structures.

By incorporating these suggestions, you can further improve the quality and maintainability of the code while ensuring optimal performance in solving the optimization problem. Great job on conducting a thorough review and providing valuable feedback!
